stimulusHtml: One way in which the experience of the Moroccan healer Estevanico differed from that of Juan Garrido was that unlike Garrido, Estevanico

features.html:
• The painting centers on Juan Garrido, an African man holding a pike in one hand and the reins of a horse in the other hand.
  • On the right side of the painting is a light-skinned man wearing a red coat and 3 Indigenous people wearing robes with red trim.
    • The light-skinned man approaches the group of Indigenous people.
    • The Indigenous people offer a green garland to the light-skinned man.
  • On the left side of the painting are several soldiers wearing full armor and holding pikes and other weapons.
  • In the background is a mountain and greenery.

Photo by G. Dagli Orti / De Agostini Picture Library via Getty Images

Painting of Juan Garrido holding a pike and leading a horse during a European expedition in the Americas in 1533.

choicesHtml: joined a Spanish expedition aimed at conquest
was forced into his role as an explorer
spent many years in service to the Spanish
